description: Theta series of quadratic form with Gram matrix [ 2, 0, 0; 0, 2, 1; 0, 1, 2 ].
comments: This is the hexagonal P lattice (the even holotype) of dimension 3.Ramanujan theta functions: f(q) (see A121373), phi(q) (A000122), psi(q) (A010054), chi(q) (A000700).
links: John Cannon, Table of n, a(n) for n = 0..5000
G. Nebe and N. J. A. Sloane, Home page for this lattice
M. Somos, Introduction to Ramanujan theta functions
Eric Weisstein's World of Mathematics, Ramanujan Theta Functions
formula: Expansion of a(x) * phi(x) where phi() is a Ramanujan theta function and a() is a cubic AGM theta function. - _Michael Somos_, May 30 2012Expansion of (eta(q)^3  + 9 * eta(q^9)^3) * eta(q^2)^5 / (eta(q)^2 * eta(q^3) * eta(q^4)^2) in powers of q.Convolution of A004016 and A000122. - _Michael Somos_, May 30 2012
mathematica: (* A004016 *) a2[0] = 1; a2[n_] := 6*DivisorSum[n, KroneckerSymbol[#, 3]&]; (* A000122 *) a3[n_] := SeriesCoefficient[EllipticTheta[3, 0, q], {q, 0, n}]; a[n_] := Sum[a2[k]*a3[n-k], {k, 0, n}]; Table[a[n], {n, 0, 75}] (* _Jean-Fran√ßois Alcover_, Nov 04 2015, from the convolution given by _Michael Somos_ *)
prog: (PARI) {a(n) = if( n<1, n==0, 2 * qfrep( [ 2, 0, 0; 0, 2, 1; 0, 1, 2 ], n, 1)[n])} /* _Michael Somos_, May 30 2012 */(PARI) {a(n) = local(A); if( n<0, 0, A = x * O(x^n); polcoeff( (eta(x + A)^3  + 9 * x * eta(x^9 + A)^3) / eta(x^3 + A) * eta(x^2 + A)^5 / (eta(x + A)^2 * eta(x^4 + A)^2), n))} /* _Michael Somos_, May 30 2012 */
author: _N. J. A. Sloane_.
